Text: The food cart area is crowded with people.

Food carts are always extra-lively this time of day,
aren't they. I suppose we're not even at peak-crowd
levels.

Hey, just a thought, but aren't less-crowded places
better for dates?

What...? You want to go someplace where we can be
alone? Are you a closet romantic?
No, that's not what I meant...

Cid lowers his voice so as not be heard by the
people around them.

What I meant to say was that it's probably not good
PR for people to see their princess walking around
with some guy.
But if people do see us, it's fine. We're dating.
Why do I have to be so discreet?

As long as you're okay with it, I don't mind. But
won't we cause a scandal?
Don't worry. You're overthinking this.

Oh! That food cart over there looks really good.
And I was just getting hungry anyway.

I'm ready to order. Could I have...this and this for
the fillings? And I'd love extra sauce.

Right away, Miss! You've got good eyes, spotting the
day's special right off the bat.

The shop owner deftly fills the bread with grilled
meat and steamed vegetables. Food carts are fun
because they let me eat exactly what I'm in the
mood for that day.
Here ya go! Thanks for coming so often!

Well, your food is really good. It's...addictive, I
suppose? I sometimes get a craving for it.

Oh, that's so sweet! Actually, the secret's in the
spices. I use a slightly different blend than the
other places.

Ooh, the spices, eh? Now that you mention it, I do
feel a little tingle. The fragrance sort of goes out
the nose, right?

Right! The shops around here use unique ingredients
and flavors—I recommend you try them all!

Haha, trying them all is a tall order. But thanks,
ma'am. I'll come back soon.
Thanks, Miss!
The lady at that food cart...do you know her?

Do I know her...hmm, I suppose so. We often chat when
she doesn't have a line of customers.

Then there's the ice cream stand over there—I often
get free toppings.

...Is it really that funny to you that I would
engage in small talk with shop owners?

Well, the cart owner we just passed waved at you,
too. I guess a lot of people here recognize you.
I'm a regular at many of these places.

A lot of these shops season their food much more
strongly than school food or our meals at home—
and I really like that.

It's just like that last shopkeeper said, each places
uses a different seasoning, so you never get tired
of it. These are flavors I don't taste often at home.

And the prices are reasonable, besides. The small
portions are also great for when you want to eat a
little snack as you walk.

I don't suppose I even need to tell you about all of
this—you come here with your friends, don't you?

Sometimes, yeah. But I had no idea you were such
a fan of open-air markets.

It's not the open-air markets specifically...it's the
gathering of people from all different classes and
countries. It's like a melting pot. It's a surprisingly
comforting feeling.

I've never gotten a taste of such bustle and cheer in
the tiny world of royal palaces.

Though when I first told my big sister I liked eating
at open-air markets, she grumbled that it was very
improper.

If she found out I liked to eat while walking,
I imagine she'd give me a furious scolding.

Yeah, I imagine so. I feel like I'm seeing a new side
of you today, Alexia.

Heehee, what, did you assume I was a delicate little
princess who can't walk down the street by herself?
Uh, I never once called you delicate.
Well...!

Whoa! That was good for the body... Well, that's the
kind of place is it... I mean...

See, truth be told...I'm actually kind of surprised
to see you connecting so well with this commoner-
lifestyle stuff.

I mean, I can understand it with low-level
aristocrats like myself, but you're, you know,
a princess.

It's because I'm a princess, though. I want to know
how my subjects live their lives. I can't rule them
properly if I don't.

There are things I can't witness if I'm cooped up in
the castle all the time.

I don't think that I'll be able to fully understand
how the other half lives just by walking around
town a little. I'm not that arrogant.
Wow...
Heehee, has your opinion of me improved a little now?
Nope, not a bit.

Hey, you're supposed to say, "Yes! I was so wrong
about you!"

By the way...do any of these people know you're a
princess? They're all acting oddly normal around you.

Oh, they found out long ago. But they all pretend not
to notice I'm a princess.

Since my lifestyle is always so cramped, these little
moments where I'm not perceived like a princess...
They're like therapy to me.
Cramped lifestyle...?
You look like you're going to argue again.
Not really.
Oh, look! Isn't that Princess Alexia?
Pooch...we're running for it.
Heh? Why...

The food cart owners may act discreet around me,
but passersby don't. We need to get out of here
before they form a crowd!
See you later, sir! You too, ma'am!

Why're you looking at me like that? I'll bet you're
thinking the only good thing about me is my looks.

No, I was actually thinking you're surprisingly
considerate.

Li-Listen, you! Grovel all you want, I'm not gonna
give you another coin!

If only you'd pass some of that consideration onto
me...

Why do I need to be considerate with you, Pooch?
C'mon, hurry!
Alexia grabs Cid's arm and dashes away at top-speed.
We should be safe all the way out here.

Why're you spacing out? Don't tell me you're out of
breath from a little light running.

So, hey...did you sense anyone staring at us while we
were running away?

Yeah, I did. That's why we changed locations before
more people noticed us.

That's not how I meant it...well... Whatever. Maybe
I'm just imagining things.

You're weird. Well! Let's pick up where we left off
on our date.
Aww, there's more? But I wanna go home—

But before Cid can finish his sentence, Alexia tosses
a coin onto the ground.
I shall accompany you anywhere, Princess!
Heehee, good boy, Pooch.
